Name: Requiring the dept of small business services to assess the state of storefront businesses.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of small business services to assess the state of storefront businesses

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Summary: The bill would require the Department of Small Business Services (SBS) to complete an assessment of the state of storefront businesses in at least twenty community districts in the City once every three years. The bill would further require SBS in coordination with the department of finance and city planning to produce a report containing information related to storefront businesses. The report would include information related to storefront business environment, such as the number of storefront businesses, the types of economic activities, the numbers of employees at such storefronts, annual sales and sales tax, the number of vacant storefront businesses, and district demographics.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. \cf1 Chapter 10 of title 22 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 22-1003 to read as follows:\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\'a7 22-1003 State of storefront businesses assessment. a. Definitions. \highlight2 For the purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:   \par
Storefront business. The term \ldblquote storefront business\rdblquote  means a\highlight0  \ldblquote ground floor commercial premises\rdblquote  as such term is defined in \'a7 11-3001.\par
\highlight2 Storefront business assessment. The term \ldblquote storefront business assessment\rdblquote  means an analysis of a community district\rquote s storefront business environment, including, but not limited to, the following factors: \par
(i) district demographics; \par
(ii) number of storefront businesses; \par
(iii) types of \highlight0 goods or services provided by \highlight2 storefront businesses and consumer spending by each type;\par
(iv) number of vacant storefront properties;\par
(v) physical conditions of storefront businesses, including interior and exterior conditions of businesses, both occupied by commercial tenants and vacant; \par
(vi) built environment of the community district; \par
(vii) challenges facing commercial tenants of storefront businesses;\par
(viii) storefront business involvement with community based organizations; and\par
(viii) opportunities for promoting various types of commercial uses and improving the built environment within the community district.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0\highlight0 b. Beginning October 1, 2019 and no less frequently than once every three years thereafter, the department shall commence a \cf1\highlight2 storefront business assessment\cf0\highlight0  in at least twenty community districts in the city. As part of such assessment, the department shall distribute to and collect from storefront business owners in the district, a survey that shall include, but not be limited to, the following requests for information:\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf1 1.   the business owners\rquote  demographic information;\par
2.  the business owners\rquote  access to, and the accessibility of, information made publicly available by the department and other agencies to support storefront businesses;\par
3.   business entity type and whether each storefront business is part of a franchise or chain;\par
4.   number of owners and number of employees of each storefront business; and\par
5.   number of years each storefront business has been located at its current location.\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\qj Such assessment shall include input by at least one community based organization serving the district\rquote s storefront business community, or if no organization is available, a record of outreach to at least three organizations requesting their participation.\cf0  \cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0 c. By September 1, 2019, and every three years thereafter, the department shall submit to the Council a list of the community districts for which storefront assessments shall be commenced and the criteria for such selections.  At the completion of each assessment, the department shall make the results of such assessment including all disaggregated non-identifying survey data\cf1 , \cf0 available on its website.  \par
d. The department, in consultation with the departments of city planning and finance, shall produce a report containing information related to storefront businesses citywide, which shall be disaggregated by community district, and include but need not be limited to the following factors: (i) the number of storefront businesses; (ii) the types of economic activity being conducted at such storefronts; (iii) data relating to numbers of employees at such storefronts; (iv) data relating to annual sales and sales tax data at such storefronts; (v) the number of vacant storefront businesses; and (vi) demographics. The department shall post such report on its website no later than 24 months after the local law that added this section takes effect and shall update such report annually. \par
\cf1\highlight2\ulnone\'a7 2.  This local law takes effect immediately.\cf0\highlight0\ul\par
